heroTitle: Engineered for Austin’s terrain: Beautiful, durable outdoor living
heroCopy: From drainage-first patios to structural retaining walls, we match you with crews who prioritize longevity, proper engineering, and year-round usability.
benefits: Specialists in patios, seat walls, steps, and structural retaining walls
Permeable and traditional paver systems with drainage planning
Introductions to verified crews who understand Austin's unique soil conditions

commonProblems.solution: Specialists integrate proper grading and drainage solutions (french drains, swales) into every hardscape design to protect your home's foundation.
Our partners prioritize base preparation—typically the cause of failure—using proper compaction and depth to resist shifting Texas clay soils.
Designers plan for year-round comfort using heat-dissipating pavers, strategic shade structures, and airflow considerations.
Pros handle the technical details, including engineering letters for walls and permeable coverage calculations for city review.

faqs.q: Do pros coordinate permits or HOA approvals?
faqs.a: Yes. They prep submittal packages with structural notes, product cut sheets, and finish samples. For retaining walls over 4 feet, they coordinate structural engineering.

faqs.q: What is 'permeable' hardscaping and do I need it?
faqs.a: Permeable pavers allow water to drain through joints into the ground, reducing runoff. These can help reduce impervious cover and may be beneficial for properties with drainage challenges or impervious cover limitations.

faqs.q: How long does a typical patio project take?
faqs.a: A standard patio (300-500 sq ft) typically takes 1-2 weeks from demo to completion. More complex projects may take longer depending on scope and complexity.

faqs.q: What kind of warranty is offered?
faqs.a: Many professionals offer workmanship warranties, but terms vary by provider and project scope. Be sure to discuss warranty options and duration with your chosen contractor.
